result.execSummary:
The defendant Troy D. Clark was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
No objection to EMP if defendant qualifies.
Concurrent with: Count 2

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Troy D. Clark

records.addlTxt: Defendant refused to sign at MCJ on 9/14/22
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 2:08 pm 
State appears by ADA Rory McGarry: Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Paul Rohloff. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 

PLEA: Ct. 1 (Battery/Repeater)>>GUILTY. 
         : Ct. 2 (DC/Repeater)>>GUILTY. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: On Each>>12 months MCJ with 57 days credit to run CONCURRENT - no objection to EMP if def qualifies; CC including DNA surcharge (sample already on file) with 60 days to pay or set up payment plan. 
Adj: 2:15 pm
